data.title: The Ice Cream Blonde’s Death in a Veil of Fumes

data.text:
Dreams can be taken away in an instant. No life illustrates it clearer than Thelma Todd, the Ice Cream Blonde, whose time on earth was cut short just as she was exploring new exciting horizons. Too many judged her by her beauty alone, with many trying to take advantage of her because of it. Even after over eighty years, the beloved actress’s demise remains a mystery, despite the investigations of countless sleuths. Still, a kernel of truth remains hidden between the many myths.

A bridge to Hollywood

Thelma Todd was born on 29 July 1906 in Lawrence, Massachusetts. She would take part in various school stage productions, and after she graduated she continued to take to the stage as a dancer, model, or actor. Show business was fickle though, so Thelma started her teacher training at Lowell Normal School in around 1924. The next year, she entered the Miss Lawrence beauty pageant — more due to her friend’s insistence than anything else, since she didn’t believe she was attractive enough to stand a chance. Still, the judges were so impressed by her that she won the competition.
